(Translated by Google) I had a particularly frustrating experience this morning at the Orange store in Leuven. I went there to transfer my current contract to the new owner of my investment property. Instead of help, I received a blunt answer: I had to send in a modem and a digital box, and the new owner would be without internet and TV for up to two weeks. According to them, "that's always the case," and the same goes for Telenet.

As a precaution, I then called the Orange helpdesk, and to my surprise, I actually received friendly assistance. The contract transfer was arranged immediately, without all the hassle the store employees claimed.

It's obvious that the employees in Leuven don't know their jobs and are only interested in selling. Customer-focused service seems completely absent. They'll never see me again.

(Translated by Google) The story is that a week ago, my mother saw a phone on sale, and since it's rare for her to like it, we decided to go to Orange for the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 256GB.

Actually, the phone costs ‚Ç¨1,199 basic without a contract, and they were having a sale with a contract for ‚Ç¨9 to give away instead of the ‚Ç¨699 basic price without the sales.

And my daughter and I went to get her one, except they were out of stock. So, they ordered the phone in coral. We paid for the phone the same day in cash for ‚Ç¨9, which means it was on August 28, 2025.

And the man told us that we wouldn't have to pay more for the phone. When he received the order, he would call us to let us know to come pick it up and then take care of the subscription.

And here today, they left a message in the message box since they hadn't been able to reach us by phone. They said that unfortunately they hadn't received the coral color and that they no longer had it in stock. Unfortunately, since it was no longer on sale, we would have to pay an extra ‚Ç¨190 or bring back a phone we no longer use, which would amount to ‚Ç¨199, even though we paid for the phone on the day of the sale and that they should have planned for more phones at that time.

But when we found out, we tried calling Rue du Trieu-Kaisin, 71 Box 229 - 6200 CHATELINEAU, except he didn't have a phone to ring. So I called 5000, and the person I spoke to told me that they had plenty of stock, and found it strange that we hadn't received proof of order by email or text message for the Samsung phone... even though we paid ‚Ç¨9.00.

He wanted to know the order number, and since I didn't have it, he advised us to go directly to the store to check with them.

And finally, the man we spoke to was the same one we spoke to on July 28, 2025, for the phone. He respected the same order they had given in the message box he had left, and the worst part was that the price hadn't been changed and was still ‚Ç¨9.

He told us he didn't have any stock and that he had forgotten to change the price.

I think when you run a sale, you should plan for a lot more stock, or else you Remove the promotion at that point, explain why to the customer, and offer another type of phone that's on sale and available.

I wanted to point out that you're making false advertisements and that it's not worth buying an expensive phone with a subscription. You're liars, and so is Orange.
We're very unhappy üò†

En tant que professionnel, Orange m‚Äôavait fait perdre beaucoup d‚Äôargent. J‚Äôavais fait une demande d‚Äôinstallation de wifi autour du 28 octobre. On m‚Äôavait indiqu√© des raisons comme ¬´ j‚Äôai sonn√© ¬ª ou ¬´ j‚Äôai frapp√© ¬ª, alors que nous √©tions pr√©sents, pr√™ts √† ouvrir. Certaines fois, je n‚Äôavais re√ßu aucune notification, ce qui m‚Äôavait fait perdre plusieurs journ√©es de travail √† attendre sans connexion.

J‚Äôavais signal√© ces probl√®mes √† plusieurs reprises et tous mes appels ont √©t√© enregistr√©s. J‚Äôavais fait tout le n√©cessaire pour que l‚Äôinstallation ait lieu, sans r√©sultat. Cette situation m‚Äôavait caus√© d‚Äôimportantes pertes et j'ai d√ª au final faire appel √† un autre op√©rateur.

Il y a un souci √©galement avec le personnel du callcenter, certaines employ√©es n'h√©sitent pas √† vous raccrocher au nez si la demande est emb√™tante √† traiter ou s'il ne reste que 5 min avant la fin de leur shift. (Samedi 2 ao√ªt 2025 √† 19.48 et 19.52 on m'a raccroch√© au nez)

(Translated by Google)
As a professional, Orange had made me lose a lot of money. I had requested Wi-Fi installation around October 28th. As of December 10th, it still hadn't been installed. About 12 appointments had not been honored. I was given reasons like "I rang" or "I knocked," even though we were there, ready to open. Sometimes, I received no notification, which caused me to lose several days of work waiting without a connection.

I had reported these problems several times, and all my calls were recorded. I had done everything necessary to have the installation carried out, but to no avail. This situation had caused me significant losses, and I ultimately had to use another operator.

There is also a problem with the call center staff, some employees do not hesitate to hang up on you if the request is difficult to process or if there are only 5 minutes left before the end of their shift. (Saturday August 2, 2025 at 7:48 p.m. and 7:52 p.m. I was hung up on)

Tres de√ßu ...Publicit√© mensong√®re. Achetez un nouveau telephone et comme on est tres vert, on vous reprend votre ancien telephone (avec cashback) (ReCycle comme ils disent). Action speciale en plus du recyclage + 40 euros si vous commandez via internet. Je n'ai bien sur jamais eu ces 40 euros et apres passage chez Orange , confirmation que ce n'est jamais le cas...
Telephone de moins d'un an sans aucun soucis (toujours rest√© dans la coque avec protege ecran ) CompRecycle (contractant de Orange) me renvoi un email me disant qu'ils ne peuvent malheuresement pas donner suite ( donc 0 euro) avec des photos (preuves a l'appui) qui ne correspondent pas du tout a mon t√©l√©phone. Ce t√©l√©phone sera tres prochainement revendu comme certifi√© neuf (recycled). Ceci est une arnaque qui est deja remont√©e vers test achats. Une plainte va etre d√©pos√©e d'ici quelques minutes chez orange m√™me.

Si par hasard le service client veut me contacter, ils sont les bienvenues. Pour ma part je termine le mois et a partir de septembre je repasse a la concurence ou finalement j'aurais du rester. Un client de perdu... qui aurait tres bien pu se regler via un geste commercial. Internet business + 5 GSMs .... directement a la concurence.

Comment un telephone Samsung A53 black peut il avoir une coque argent√©e ( premiere photo (celle d'un iPhone d'apres les boutons sur le cot√©)), pourquoi la photo de l'ecran est sans protege ecran alors que celle, vue de cot√©, est avec une protege ecran. De plus .... pourquoi y a t il un protege ecran alors que je l'ai moi meme enlev√© avant de l'envoyer.

(Translated by Google)
Very disappointed... False advertising. Buy a new phone and since we're very green, we'll take back your old phone (with cashback) (ReCycle, as they say). Special promotion in addition to recycling + 40 euros if you order online. Of course, I never received this 40 euros, and after a trip to Orange, I confirmed that this is never the case...
Phone less than a year old without any problems (always in the case with screen protector). CompRecycle (Orange's contractor) sent me an email saying that they unfortunately cannot follow up (so 0 euros) with photos (with supporting evidence) that do not match my phone at all. This phone will very soon be resold as certified new (recycled). This is a scam that has already been reported to Test Achats. A complaint will be filed within a few minutes with Orange itself.

If by any chance customer service wants to contact me, they're welcome to do so. Personally, I'm finishing the month and starting in September, I'll be going back to the competition, where I should have stayed. A lost customer... who could have easily been settled with a goodwill gesture. Business internet + 5 cell phones... directly to the competition.

How can a black Samsung A53 phone have a silver case (first photo (that of an iPhone, judging by the buttons on the side)), why is the screen photo without a screen protector when the one, seen from the side, is with a screen protector? Furthermore... why is there a screen protector when I removed it myself before sending it?

Reply... these photos are not from my phone...

(Translated by Google) Today I went specifically to the Orange store in Oudenaarde to have a problem checked for my friend. Unfortunately, I'm not at all satisfied with the service I received there.

My 5G connection hasn't been working for **over a week**, even though I'm paying for my subscription. This is incredibly frustrating, because I have a service I pay for, but I can't use it right now.

Unfortunately, I wasn't offered any solution in the store. The employee who helped me seemed to have little knowledge of the iPhone or of possible steps that could be taken to solve the problem. She also didn't seem very friendly. A male colleague provided continuous support, but even together they couldn't give me a concrete answer or offer a solution.

This is very disappointing for me. I've been having this problem for a week now, and my subscription continues, even though it's of no use to me. Moreover, I'm leaving on a trip soon, and it's urgent that my 5G is working again. The fact that the store hasn't taken any action to help me makes me feel abandoned as a customer.

I expect this problem to be resolved as quickly as possible and that appropriate compensation will be provided for the time I was unable to use my 5G.

(Original)
Vandaag ben ik speciaal naar de Orange-shop in Oudenaarde gegaan om een probleem te laten nakijken voor mijn vriend. Helaas ben ik helemaal niet tevreden over de service die ik daar kreeg.

Mijn 5G-verbinding werkt al **meer dan een week niet**, terwijl ik wel gewoon betaal voor mijn abonnement. Dit is enorm frustrerend, want ik heb een dienst waarvoor ik betaal, maar die ik momenteel niet kan gebruiken.

In de winkel kreeg ik helaas geen enkele oplossing aangeboden. De medewerkster die mij hielp, leek weinig kennis te hebben van de iPhone of van mogelijke stappen die ondernomen konden worden om het probleem op te lossen. Dit is voor mij erg teleurstellend. Ik heb dit probleem nu al een week, en intussen loopt mijn abonnement gewoon door terwijl ik er niets aan heb. Bovendien vertrek ik binnenkort op reis en is het dringend noodzakelijk dat mijn 5G weer werkt. column4:
(Translated by Google) I wanted to switch my small business to a single telecom provider. So, what's available on the market? We have multiple locations, so we're testing one provider per location, and the best one will take everything next year. We ordered from Orange: internet, TV, and two mobile phones. After a week, still no response from Orange, even though we received a confirmation email after placing the order. So I called customer service with my order number. From then on, the trouble began; they couldn't understand that I wasn't a customer yet and therefore didn't have a customer number. They could only search by order number or company name. If that didn't work, they transferred me to another call center agent. The same questions kept coming up, but these people were anything but friendly and willing to help. After the third call center agent, I gave up. But a few days later, I thought maybe I could go to an Orange shop for help and get everything sorted out. So I went to the Orange Shop in Ostend. Upon arrival, I walked up to a desk where an employee was scrolling through his phone. Facebook turned out to be very interesting. I asked, "Can you please help me with my order? Here's the number." But to my surprise, he wouldn't even look at my email. He snapped at me that online orders weren't for them and that he couldn't do anything. When I asked if I could possibly change this to a direct order from them, he didn't understand, and I had to call their customer service myself. Their arrogance and lack of willingness to help customers have only ensured that I will never, ever have anything to do with Orange again. The search continues for internet, TV, and mobile services from a single provider.

(Original)
Ik wou met mijn klein bedrijf overstappen op √©√©n telecom provider. Dus wat is aanwezig op de markt. We hebben meerdere locaties dus we testen √©√©n provider per locatie en de beste neemt alles volgend jaar. We bestellen bij Orange. Internet + TV + 2 mobile. Na een week nog altijd geen reactie van Orange alhoewel we een bevestiging mail ontvangen hadden na de bestelling. Dus ik bel met het bestellingsnummer naar de klantendienst. Vanaf dan begint de miserie men begrijpt maar niet dat ik nog geen klant ben en dus geen klantennummer heb. Ze kunnen enkel zoeken op het bestelnummer of de naam van het bedrijf. Als dat niet gaat verbinden ze me door naar een andere callcenter agent. En dezelfde vragen komen naar boven maar deze mensen zijn alles behalve vriendelijk en welwillend om je te helpen. Na de derde callcenter agent heb ik het opgegeven. Maar een paar dagen later dacht ik misschien kan ik eens naar een orange shop gaan voor hulp en alles nog in orde te krijgen. Dus ik ging naar de Orange Shop in Oostende. Bij aankomst stapte ik naar een desk waar een medewerker wat op zijn gsm zat te schrollen, fb bleek heel interessant, ik stelde mijn vraag, kan je aub me helpen met mijn bestelling hier is het nummer... Maar tot mijn verbazing wou hij eigenlijk niet eens naar de email kijken.  Hij snauwde me dat bestellingen op het web niet voor hun was en dat hij niets kon doen. Toen ik vroeg om eventueel dit aan te passen naar een bestelling van hun begreep hij het niet en ik moest eerst maar zelf naar de hun customerservice bellen... De arogantie en het ontbreken van elke will om een klant te helpen... heeft er alleen maar voor gezorgd dat ik nooit maar dan ook nooit meer iets met Orange te maken will hebben... De zoektocht gaat verder om internet+TV+Mobiel bij √©√©n leverancier te halen...

Excellent service in the store with the English speaking gentlemen but that‚Äôs where the good service stops.
I scheduled Internet installation and had to leave work 4 hours early for an appointment that was between 1 PM and 6PM.
The technician arrived at 2:30 PM approximately which was great, but he parked across the street. I was watching him from my window. My front door was literally propped open. He didn‚Äôt approach my house.
I walked away from the window to get my phone for Google translate and was about to walk out to greet him, but then he drove away.

column8: Hi Sandra, thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre glad the in-store team could help you in English, and we‚Äôre truly sorry for what happened with your installation and the follow-up. A technician leaving without approaching your door and then marking you as not at home, combined with the difficulty rescheduling and the language barrier, is not the experience we want for you. Being made to feel at fault because you don‚Äôt speak French is unacceptable, and we sincerely apologize. We are sharing your comments with our field operations and customer care teams to improve technician procedures, appointment handling, and language support. If you decide to give us another chance, our team can review your case and arrange a new appointment with English support via Messenger: https://www.facebook.com/OrangeBelgium. Je vous √©cris cet avis pour vous faire part de mon profond m√©contentement suite √† une visite dans le magasin du shopping de Nivelles ce 20 septembre 2025 vers 13h40. Si je pouvais noter mon exp√©rience, ce serait un z√©ro.

Ce n'est malheureusement pas la premi√®re fois que je suis d√©√ßu par vos services. J'ai r√©cemment d√ª me rendre trois fois en boutique pour une simple affaire de carte SIM et de nouvel abonnement, ce qui t√©moignait d√©j√† d'un manque criant de comp√©tence.

Cependant, l'incident d'aujourd'hui d√©passe l'entendement. Voici le d√©roul√© des faits :

Je suis entr√© dans le magasin, j'ai pris un ticket. Deux employ√©s √©taient occup√©s, j'√©tais donc le prochain client √† √™tre servi.
Apr√®s une dizaine de minutes, un employ√© s'est lib√©r√©. C'√©tait donc mon tour.
Une autre personne, arriv√©e apr√®s moi, a pos√© une question sur un article. Contre toute attente, votre employ√© a d√©cid√© de servir cette personne qui n'avait pas attendu son tour.
Lorsque j'ai interpell√© l'employ√© pour lui demander √† quoi servait le syst√®me de tickets si l'ordre de passage n'√©tait pas respect√©, il m'a r√©pondu, √† tort, que ce client √©tait l√† avant moi. Le client lui-m√™me semblait g√™n√© par la situation.
Face au m√©pris total de votre employ√©, qui n'a montr√© aucune consid√©ration, j'ai jet√© mon ticket et j'ai quitt√© le magasin, en recevant au passage une r√©flexion d√©sobligeante de sa part.
Un tel comportement est inadmissible et t√©moigne d'un manque de professionnalisme flagrant. On retrouve malheureusement la m√™me incomp√©tence que chez VOO, et il semble que le personnel soit le m√™me.

Je suis un client, pas une personne qui a du temps √† perdre face √† un service aussi d√©plorable. Cette exp√©rience me pousse s√©rieusement √† reconsid√©rer mon choix de rester chez vous et √† conseiller √† mon entourage de fuir vos services.

J'attends de votre part une r√©ponse et, surtout, des mesures concr√®tes pour am√©liorer la qualit√© de service et le respect du client dans vos points de vente

(Translated by Google)
I'm writing this review to express my deep dissatisfaction following a visit to the Nivelles shopping center on September 20, 2025, at around 1:40 p.m. If I could rate my experience, it would be a zero.

Unfortunately, this isn't the first time I've been disappointed by your service. I recently had to go to the store three times for a simple matter involving a SIM card and a new subscription, which already demonstrated a glaring lack of competence.

However, today's incident is beyond comprehension. Here's how it unfolded:

I entered the store and took a receipt. Two employees were busy, so I was the next customer to be served.
After about ten minutes, an employee became available. It was my turn.
Another person, who arrived after me, asked a question about an item. Against all expectations, your employee decided to serve this person who hadn't waited their turn. When I asked the employee what the ticket system was for if the order of arrival wasn't respected, he incorrectly told me that the customer had arrived before me. The customer himself seemed bothered by the situation.
Faced with the total disregard of your employee, who showed no consideration, I threw away my ticket and left the store, receiving a derogatory comment from him in the process.
Such behavior is unacceptable and demonstrates a blatant lack of professionalism. Unfortunately, we find the same incompetence as at VOO, and it seems the staff is the same.

I am a customer, not someone who has time to waste dealing with such deplorable service. This experience seriously makes me reconsider my decision to stay with you and advise those around me to avoid your services.

I await a response from you and, above all, concrete measures to improve the quality of service and respect for customers in your stores.

As an Orange customer for over 10 years, I've always bought my iPhones from them... until yesterday. When I tried to order an iPhone 17 Pro in a store, the salesperson asked me if I was Belgian. I showed my Belgian residence permit (which clearly proves my residency in Belgium), and I was told that since I wasn't a Belgian national, I couldn't order.

Je me permets de vous √©crire pour vous faire part de ma grande d√©ception suite √† ma visite dans votre boutique Orange situ√©e √† Belle-√éle.

Cliente fid√®le chez Orange depuis plus de 15 ans, je m‚Äôattendais √† un minimum de consid√©ration et de qualit√© de service. Malheureusement, l‚Äôexp√©rience a √©t√© tr√®s en dessous de ce que l‚Äôon est en droit d‚Äôattendre d‚Äôune enseigne comme la v√¥tre.

Je n‚Äôai re√ßu aucun conseil, aucune proposition d‚Äôaccessoires, de garantie, ni m√™me la moindre forme d‚Äôassistance ou d‚Äô√©coute. Concernant une simple demande de changement de nom sur mon abonnement ‚Äì pour passer du nom de mon p√®re au mien, sachant qu‚Äôil s‚Äôagit de mon num√©ro et que c‚Äôest moi qui r√®gle les factures depuis toujours ‚Äì on m‚Äôa s√®chement r√©pondu de revenir dans trois mois si je voulais obtenir un nouveau t√©l√©phone. Une r√©ponse totalement inappropri√©e, voire limite, au regard de la situation.

De plus, j‚Äôavais droit √† une tablette en cadeau avec mon t√©l√©phone. Au lieu de m‚Äôexpliquer les d√©marches, l‚Äôh√¥tesse m‚Äôa simplement dit de "voir sur internet", pr√©cisant que ce n‚Äô√©tait "pas elle qui g√©rait", mais Samsung. Aucun site, aucune consigne, aucun support ne m‚Äôa √©t√© fourni. Dans mes exp√©riences pass√©es, les cadeaux √©taient remis directement en boutique, sans ce genre de renvoi vague et peu professionnel.

Je trouve cela extr√™mement regrettable. Les commerces traditionnels se plaignent de la concurrence du e-commerce, mais force est de constater qu‚Äôun robot en ligne est parfois plus accueillant, plus clair et plus efficace que certaines personnes peu investies dans leur r√¥le.

Bien √† vous

(Translated by Google)
Hello,

I am writing to express my great disappointment following my visit to your Orange store on Belle-√éle.

As a loyal Orange customer for over 15 years, I expected a minimum of consideration and quality of service. Unfortunately, the experience fell far short of what one would expect from a brand like yours.

The store was completely empty when I arrived, but despite this, the receptionist displayed a haughty and clearly unprofessional attitude, as if my arrival had disturbed her during her lunch break.

I received no advice, no offer of accessories, no warranty, nor even the slightest form of assistance or listening. Regarding a simple request to change the name on my subscription‚Äîfrom my father's to mine, knowing that it's my number and that I've always been the one paying the bills‚ÄîI was curtly told to come back in three months if I wanted a new phone. A completely inappropriate, even borderline, response given the situation.

Furthermore, I was entitled to a free tablet with my phone. Instead of explaining the process, the receptionist simply told me to "look it up online," specifying that it was "not her who managed it," but Samsung. No website, no instructions, no support was provided. In my past experiences, gifts were handed out directly in the store, without this kind of vague and unprofessional referral.

I find this extremely regrettable. Traditional businesses complain about competition from e-commerce, but it's clear that an online robot is sometimes more welcoming, clearer, and more efficient than some people who are not fully committed to their role.

Yours faithfully

Apr√®s plus de dix ann√©es de fid√©lit√© et d‚Äôachats r√©guliers dans cette boutique, y compris avec des appareils en moins bon √©tat, je consid√®re cette exp√©rience comme inacceptable et indigne d‚Äôune enseigne telle qu‚ÄôOrange. (Translated by Google)
As an Orange customer for over ten years and a regular at Louise's store, I have always received reliable and professional service. However, my latest experience at this store represents a clear departure from this standard.

In fact, when I traded in my iPhone, the store manager made a clearly incorrect assessment. She claimed the screen had scratches, even though it was perfectly intact: the only visible marks were fine micro-scratches located on the protective glass, not on the device's screen. The phone was otherwise in excellent condition, apart from a very slight dent on the upper left frame. Despite this, I was offered a ridiculously low trade-in price, without any coherent justification and much lower than the estimates I had obtained from other stores and online.

The manager's general demeanor was unprofessional: she used informally, her manner was informal, and her gestures were abrupt. Added to this was a completely inappropriate element: the constant presence of the security guard during the inspection, who even went so far as to comment on the condition of my phone. Such intrusion is not only inappropriate but also contrary to the expected practices in a business relationship.

I requested a second opinion from another sales representative, who offered an even lower trade-in price, without any explanation, simply stating that he didn't have to justify himself. When I questioned the manager about these inconsistencies, her response‚Äî"it varies from one store to another"‚Äîfurther demonstrated the lack of transparency in this process. Finally, the model I wanted to replace was not in stock, making the process even more frustrating and pointless.

After more than ten years of loyalty and regular purchases from this store, including with devices in poor condition, I consider this experience unacceptable and unworthy of a brand like Orange. It is urgent that measures be taken to ensure that this point of sale regains the seriousness, transparency and professionalism that should be the norm.

column4:
(Translated by Google) It's been a long time since I had a bad experience there (I never went back, of course), I think it was around July 2024. I'd already tried a few times to get a contract with a mobile phone (for, say, ‚Ç¨9, which you then pay off via a monthly invoice), but that was only allowed once per person. And to do this for my father, he absolutely had to be present, even though I had his ID with me. And I understand that. It's all fine. But when I wanted to ask a question (after I'd already been there a few times to try, but still), her colleague said to her: "Are you really going to bother with this? This is a waste of time?" I did eventually ask my question, but after that, I gave up. It's a shame, because I just wanted to buy a phone without a contract, which I ended up buying from Telenet. If her colleague hadn't spoken to her like that, I would have definitely bought the phone from Orange.
Update 26/10: I forgot about this yesterday. My father also wanted to take advantage of that offer, but he can't make it to the store himself. He finally managed to do it online. But of course, my father knew I had his ID, so it was all with his approval.
(I also see that the owner has since responded, but I don't care about that.)

Het is al lang geleden dat ik er een slechte ervaring had (ben daarna nooit meer terug gegaan uiteraard), ik denk juli 2024 ofzo. Uiteindelijk heb ik wel mijn vraag gesteld, maar nadien ben ik het ook afgebold. Jammer want ik wou juist gewoon zo een gsm kopen zonder abonnement, die ik uiteindelijk bij Telenet ben gaan kopen. (Translated by Google) I would like to share a very bad experience I had with the Orange Belgium Basilix store.
Following the theft of my mother's cell phone (76 years old), we went together to buy a new one. She already had a Love package (TV, internet, and mobile). In the store, several Samsung models we requested were no longer available. The salesperson then offered us a Samsung A36 for ‚Ç¨329. He told us that, thanks to the Love package, my mother would benefit from a discount, which brought the price down to ‚Ç¨229. The offer seemed reasonable, so we decided to buy it. Since the number had to be reactivated following the theft, we were asked to come back the next day.
The next day, I couldn't accompany my mother. She returned alone and ran into another salesperson. Instead of paying ‚Ç¨229 as agreed, she was charged ‚Ç¨329, under the pretext that her subscription was "too small" to benefit from the discount. My mother, lost and embarrassed in a crowded store, paid anyway. Two days later, I returned with her to resolve the problem. We were told that nothing could be done: no discount, no return, no goodwill, under the pretext that the phone box had been opened.
I find this behavior unacceptable and bordering on a breach of trust, especially when dealing with an elderly person who isn't familiar with these procedures. Between the promise of a discount that wasn't honored, the contradictory information between salespeople, and the complete lack of a solution, I strongly advise against this store.

(Translated by Google) Honestly, Orange is the place to be! I had a very bad experience with them: they regularly charged me unjustified additional fees. I was told several times that I had exceeded my gigabytes, even though in the app, my usage remained well below the limit.
I was also charged for calls abroad that I never made. When I used my mobile data in Europe, I was still charged extra, even though everything was supposed to be included in my subscription.

And the worst part: even after paying a bill, I received reminders and threats of recovery for amounts already paid! It's absurd.

I had two subscriptions (one for 15 GB and one unlimited) and I sometimes paid as much as ‚Ç¨130 or ‚Ç¨140 per month, without any clear explanation. Since I changed providers, I've been paying the same price, but everything is truly unlimited: data, calls, internet... and most importantly, no more nasty surprises on the bill.

(Translated by Google) It's a shame you can't enter zero stars, because this is the only way to do it. My wife hasn't had a connection to her phone for two weeks due to an error at the Orange helpdesk. We've been calling customer service constantly, and after two weeks, we finally get a solution. We're going to the Orange store to pick up a new physical SIM card. Since we're abroad, a family member needs to go. According to customer service, it's with power of attorney, which is also in the file. Is the family member there? Sorry, they need a physical ID. They call us, hand us the clerk. Immediately, they say, "We can't do anything, it's stuck with customer service," then technical support. They clearly tell him the problem is with Orange, and then they hang up the phone. It's a fantastic, professional attitude. Fantastic service from Orange for a family that has been a customer for 15 years. And now it's still not resolved.

column4:
(Translated by Google) Title: One year of pure misery: poor internet, incorrect reminders, and even blocking my business lines
Review:
My experience with Orange has been absolutely disastrous over the past year. The internet has almost never worked properly, causing constant problems‚Äîboth personally and professionally.
Furthermore, I was wrongly accused several times of non-payment of invoices, even though I paid everything correctly. I even settled an invoice with a credit note, duly noted in the notification, but Orange apparently "missed it."
Instead of resolving this, they simply blocked all my mobile phone subscriptions, meaning I, as a company, could no longer make or receive calls. This happened even though I had no outstanding debts‚Äîsomething they had to admit later and then quickly "forgive." By then, the damage had already been done.
What makes this situation even more absurd: they were never able to help me in the store, and every customer service representative promised that it would "be fixed." It never happened. I literally lost days calling and emailing, repeatedly giving the same explanation, to no avail.
In short: poor service, bad internet, incorrect reminders, no internal communication, and even blocking paid subscriptions. Never again will I use Orange‚Äîthis has cost me a tremendous amount of time, stress, and business damage.

I advise everyone against doing business with Orange!!!

(Original)
Titel: E√©n jaar pure ellende: slecht internet, foutieve aanmaningen en zelfs blokkeren van mijn bedrijfslijnen
Review:
Mijn ervaring met Orange is het afgelopen jaar ronduit rampzalig geweest. Het internet heeft bijna nooit fatsoenlijk gewerkt, waardoor ik voortdurend problemen had ‚Äî zowel priv√© als professioneel.
Daarnaast werd ik meerdere keren onterecht beschuldigd van het niet-betalen van facturen, terwijl ik alles correct betaalde. Ik heb zelfs een factuur gewoon verrekend met een creditnota, netjes vermeld in de mededeling, maar Orange had dat blijkbaar ‚Äúniet gezien‚Äù.
In plaats van dit op te lossen, hebben ze op een bepaald moment gewoon al mijn GSM-abonnementen geblokkeerd, waardoor ik als bedrijf niet meer kon bellen of gebeld worden. Dit gebeurde terwijl ik g√©√©n openstaande schulden had ‚Äî iets wat ze achteraf zelf moesten toegeven √©n dan maar snel ‚Äúkwijtscholden‚Äù. Ondertussen was de schade wel al aangericht.
Wat deze situatie nog absurder maakt: in de winkel konden ze me nooit helpen, en elke medewerker van de klantendienst beloofde dat het ‚Äúin orde zou komen‚Äù. Dat is nooit gebeurd. Ik ben letterlijk dagen kwijtgeraakt aan bellen en mailen, telkens opnieuw dezelfde uitleg moeten geven, zonder resultaat.
Kortom: slechte service, slecht internet, foutieve aanmaningen, geen interne communicatie en zelfs blokkeren van betaalde abonnementen. Voor mij nooit meer Orange ‚Äî dit heeft me enorm veel tijd, stress en zakelijke schade gekost.

Ik raad iedereen af om met Orange in zee te gaan!!!

column4:
(Translated by Google) I went to Orange to sign up for a phone and internet plan.

I was promised a phone plan with 60 GB of data and a promotion where I could get a year of giga-fiber internet at the latest rate.

They asked for my address to see if this connection was available, and I signed a contract for it.

Then the trouble started shortly after. They told me my mobile data would be activated the day after my visit to the store. Two days later, it still wasn't working. I spent half an hour on the phone, and they finally fixed it.

Then, a few days before my internet installation appointment, they abruptly canceled it. I called my father back, and after more than an hour on the phone, they told us the installation had been canceled because giga-fiber wasn't available at my address. They suggested switching me to the basic rate and rescheduling the following week.

A few days before the installation, I received a message that my internet service had been canceled. I called Orange, and after another half hour, they said it was a mistake and that the installation would go ahead anyway.

Later, I received a message that my appointment was scheduled for a completely different date a month away, and shortly after, another message saying the appointment for that date had been canceled. I thought it was just a mistake. Then the installation day arrived, and they simply didn't let me know. No one showed up to install my internet.

My father called them again and was transferred three times, having to explain the situation completely over and over again with each person. Finally, he reached someone who could help, and they offered to reschedule the appointment and give me a ‚Ç¨10 discount.

I found this truly insulting. They wasted several days of our time and then dared to offer ‚Ç¨10.

Thanks to this whole mess, I couldn't move out when I was supposed to.

This was a very amateurish operation!

I strongly advise everyone not to become an Orange customer. I'm currently looking for another provider myself.

(Original)
Ik heb hier bij Orange geweest om een abonnement aan te gaan van telefonie plus internet.

Er werd mij een telefoonabonnement met 60 GB data belooft en een promotie waar je kon een jaar lang gigafibre internet krijgen voor het laatste tarief.

Mijn adres werdt gevraagd om te kijken of deze aansluiting mogelijk was en ik heb daar een contract voor getekend.

Kort erna begon de miserie al. Ze zeiden tegen mij dat mijn mobile data actief zou zijn de dag na mijn bezoek bij de winkel. Twee dagen later werkte dit nog steeds niet. Ik heb dan een half uur aan de lijn gehangen en dan hebben ze dat opgelost.

Dan een paar dagen voor de afspraak voor de installatie voor mijn internet hebben ze abrupt mijn internet gecanceld. Daarna heb ik teruggebeld met mijn vader en na meer dan een uur aan de lijn hebben ze ons verteld dat de installatie gecanceld was omdat giga fiber niet mogelijk is op mijn adres. Ze stelden voor om mij over te schakelen op basis tarief en een nieuwe afspraak te maken de volgende week.

Nogmaals een paar dagen voor de installatie kreeg ik een bericht dat mijn internet gecanceld was. Ik heb dan gebeld naar orange en na een ander half uur hebben ze gezegd dat dit een fout was en dat de installatie toch doorgaat.

Dan later kreeg ik een bericht dat mijn afspraak gepland was op een compleet andere datum een maand verder, en kort daarna een ander bericht dat de afspraak op die datum gecanceld was. Gewoon een foutje dacht ik. Toen kwam de dag van de installatie en lieten ze gewoon niets weten. Er kwam niemand af om mijn internet te installeren.

Mijn vader heeft dan terug gebeld naar hun en is drie keer doorgeschakeld geweest en bij iedere persoon moest hij de situatie helemaal opnieuw uitleggen. Uiteindelijk kwam hij bij iemand die kon helpen en ze stelden voor om een nieuwe afspraak te plannen en een korting te geven van 10 euro.

Dit vond ik een echte belediging, ze hebben meerdere dagen van onze tijd verspilt en wagen het dan om af te komen met 10 euro.

Dankzij dit hele gedoe kon ik niet verhuizen wanneer dit gepland was.

Zeer amateuristisch zaakje dit!

Je ne recommande pas du dout leurs services.
J achete un NV gsm senior pour ma maman dans 87 ans.
La carte de l ancien gsm est trop grande au magasin il me dise la personne dois √™tre pr√©sente et me dirige vers le si√®ge central t√©l√©phonique car ma mama ne sais pas √™tre pr√©sente du un pb de mobilit√©.
Le 29 November a 15h19
Je contacte et explique on me dis il faud aller au magasin je lui r√©explique et sur un ton agac√© elle me dis je ne comprend pas pq il ne fond pas l √©change  je r√©pond madame ne sois ai pas agac√© j ai attendu plus de 1h au magasin qui m envoie vers vous et la bam cette personne avec un super accent bien prononcer me RACCROCHER au nez.
Elle me laisse avec le pb non r√©solu et surtout une personne de 87 ans sans aucune resource d urgence.
Donc je remercie Orange et ces personnes de leurs professonnalisme.
Et souhaite de tout mon Coeur qu un jour il soit confront√© √† se genre de situation avec un de leurs proches ou eu m√™me.
Il comprendrons s il y a un minimum de neuronne en eux.
J en profite pour passer le message arreter de m appeller pour je ne sais qu Elle promos ou autre choses.

(Translated by Google)
I absolutely do not recommend their services.

I bought a new senior mobile phone for my 87-year-old mother.

The SIM card from her old phone was too big. At the store, they told me the person had to be present and directed me to the central phone office because my mother couldn't be there due to mobility issues.

On November 29th at 3:19 PM, I contacted them and explained the situation. They told me I had to go to the store. I explained again, and in an annoyed tone, she said she didn't understand why they weren't doing the exchange. I replied, "Madam, don't be annoyed. I waited over an hour at the store, and they sent me to you." Then, bam! This person with a very strong accent hung up on me.

She left me with the problem unresolved, and, most importantly, an 87-year-old woman without any emergency resources.
So, I thank Orange and these people for their professionalism. And I sincerely hope that one day they will face this kind of situation with one of their loved ones, or even themselves.
They will understand if they have even a shred of common sense.

I'm taking this opportunity to send a message: stop calling me for whatever promotions or anything else.

This is called telephone harassment.
I'm not interested, and even less so now.

Shameful service! I went to this store to receive a SIM card that was supposed to arrive by mail but hadn't arrived after three days.

After explaining my request, the employee basically told me that "the phone company didn't know anything and it wasn't possible."
I insisted, repeating what his colleagues had said, and at one point he stood up, and Lana told me to speak to him differently.
I replied that he was authorized to answer my question, and he told me I had to leave the store. Which, of course, I didn't do. I walked away, called Orange again, and they confirmed that my request was valid and that I should wait my turn again to finalize my file. Which I did.
While I was waiting, I saw two plainclothes police officers and six others in uniform enter the shop! I was subjected to an identity check like a thug and had to leave. Get out of here, Orange!

Je poste cet avis pour ma maman qui a eu une exp√©rience vraiment d√©cevante au shop de Marche. On est clients depuis + de 10 ans et m√™me pas un petit geste commercial face √† la situation. C'est d√©cevant..
Ma maman, qui a + de 65ans, se retrouve un jour avec son smartphone qui ne charge plus et il ne lui restait que 15% de batterie. Elle essaie de me contacter mais je n'√©tais pas disponible directement et prise de panique car il ne lui restait que 15% de batterie, elle d√©cide de se d√©p√™cher pour aller au Shop orange le + proche √† savoir celui de Marche pour que quelqu'un l'aide.
Elle explique au vendeur que la veille, son t√©l√©phone √©tait un peu tomb√© dans de l'eau et qu'elle avait essay√© de le faire charger mais qu'il ne chargeait plus.
Ce qu'on lui r√©pond tout gentiment : "ah bah c'est foutu on ne sait rien faire il faut racheter un neuf." Sauf que ! Ma maman arrive vers 12h40 (bient√¥t heure de fermeture du magasin pour la pause midi) mais elle s'est vraiment d√©p√™ch√©e de peur que son t√©l√©phone s'√©teigne donc elle aimerait vraiment de l'aide, et l√† elle m'explique que ni une ni deux hop on lui propose un t√©l√©phone qui ressemble au sien et vu que c'est bient√¥t la pause d√Æner il faut quand m√™me pas tra√Æner pour acheter rapidement un t√©l√©phone et tout ce qui va avec (coque etc).
Premi√®re chose que je demande √† ma maman lorsqu'elle arrive chez moi, juste apr√®s avoir achet√© le nouveau t√©l√©phone c'est : "est-ce que tu avais essay√© avec un autre chargeur ? Peut-√™tre que le c√¢ble avait une d√©faillance." Elle me r√©pond que non.
Je prends donc un c√¢ble USB-C de chez moi et SURPRISE : il charge. PERSONNE au shop n'avait essay√© de faire charger son t√©l√©phone avec un autre chargeur... alors je ne suis pas dou√©e en informatique et ma maman √©tant stress√©e avec tout √ßa n'a pas pens√© √† √ßa, mais c'est la premi√®re chose que j'aurais fait.

Avant de reconduire le t√©l√©phone je conseille quand m√™me √† ma maman d'attendre quelques jours pour √™tre certaine qu'il recharge bien vraiment avec  tous les chargeurs. Verdict une semaine plus tard : toujours pas de probl√®me.

Elle d√©cide donc de retourner au shop et evidemment on lui dit que c'est impossible de reprendre le t√©l√©phone qu'elle a achet√©.

√ätre client depuis 10 ans, √™tre conseill√© sur un coup de t√™te, et ne pas vouloir faire un geste commercial par apr√®s alors que finalement l'achat de ce t√©l√©phone n'√©tait pas du tout utile.. elle se retrouve maintenant avec 2 t√©l√©phones, dont un qui ne lui servira √† rien.
Bref, une exp√©rience d√©cevante o√π on veut juste faire de l'argent et il n'y a m√™me plus de c√¥t√© humain derri√®re tout √ßa.

(Translated by Google)
I'm posting this review for my mother, who had a really disappointing experience at the Marche store. We've been customers for over 10 years and haven't even offered a small gesture of goodwill in light of the situation. It's disappointing. My mother, who is over 65, found herself one day with her smartphone that wouldn't charge and only 15% battery left. She tried to contact me, but I wasn't available right away, and panicking because of the low battery, she decided to rush to the nearest Orange store, the one in Marche, so someone could help her.
She explained to the salesperson that the day before, her phone had been slightly wet and she had tried to charge it, but it wouldn't charge anymore.
The response she received was, quite politely: "Oh well, it's beyond repair, there's nothing we can do, you'll have to buy a new one." Except! My mom arrived around 12:40 (almost closing time for lunch), but she was in a real hurry because she was worried her phone would die, so she really needed some help. She explained that, without hesitation, they offered her a phone that looked like hers, and since it was almost lunchtime, she couldn't wait to buy a new phone and all the accessories (case, etc.).
The first thing I asked my mom when she got home, right after she'd bought the new phone, was, "Did you try a different charger? Maybe the cable was faulty." She said no.
So I grabbed a USB-C cable from home, and SURPRISE: it charged! NO ONE at the shop had tried charging her phone with another charger... so I'm not very tech-savvy, and my mom, stressed about the whole thing, didn't think of it, but it's the first thing I would have done.

Before taking the phone back, I still advised my mom to wait a few days to be absolutely sure it charged properly with all the chargers. A week later, the verdict: still no problem.

So she decided to go back to the shop, and of course, they told her it was impossible to take back the phone she had bought.

Being a customer for 10 years, being given advice on a whim, and then not wanting to offer any compensation afterward, even though buying this phone was completely unnecessary... she's now stuck with two phones, one of which is useless to her.

In short, a disappointing experience where they just want to make money, and there's no human touch left.

Nous sommes vraiment d√©sol√©s pour la situation v√©cue, surtout apr√®s tant d‚Äôann√©es de fid√©lit√©. Ce n‚Äôest clairement pas l‚Äôaccompagnement ni l‚Äô√©coute que nous souhaitons pour nos clients, encore moins dans une situation stressante. Nous prenons vos remarques tr√®s au s√©rieux et allons les remonter √† l‚Äô√©quipe concern√©e pour am√©liorer notre service. Mais pour le reste‚Ä¶ Orange, quelle aventure !

Il y a un an, les installateurs arrivent s√ªrs d‚Äôeux, expliquant que ¬´ les autres op√©rateurs, √ßa ne vaut rien ¬ª et que leur r√©seau est ¬´ le meilleur du march√© ¬ª. R√©sultat ? Quelques semaines plus tard, un second technicien vient et d√©couvre une prise install√©e par son coll√®gue‚Ä¶ interdite en Belgique. L√†, j‚Äôai compris que le marketing √©tait probablement meilleur que la technique.

Depuis, on vit un feuilleton : cela fait des mois qu‚Äôon doit s‚Äôy prendre comme pour un lancement spatial juste pour allumer la t√©l√©vision. Red√©marrer, d√©brancher, rebrancher‚Ä¶ chaque jour. Si vous voulez regarder le JT de 13h, pr√©voyez un √©chauffement technique d√®s 12h45.

(Translated by Google)
Review left for this shop because this is where I did my entire transfer from Proximus. First of all, I want to thank Mr. Malek, who was truly impeccable.

But as for the rest‚Ä¶ Orange, what an adventure!

A year ago, the installers arrived, full of confidence, explaining that "the other operators are worthless" and that their network was "the best on the market." The result? From day one, it barely worked. And the technician's excuse: "It's your TV that's malfunctioning." Of course‚Ä¶

A few weeks later, a second technician came and discovered a socket installed by his colleague‚Ä¶ which is illegal in Belgium. That's when I realized that marketing was probably better than technology.

Since then, it's been a real saga: for months now, we've had to go through the motions of a space launch just to turn on the television. Restarting, unplugging, plugging back in‚Ä¶ every single day. If you want to watch the 1 p.m. news, plan on starting your technical warm-up at 12:45 p.m.

This morning (December 4th), a new chapter: error message "CODE D1O1" and nothing since 6:00 AM. I tried calling support: once I got through to the 02 number, the call dropped immediately. On the 5000 number, after pressing an endless series of buttons, I was finally told there was a "technical problem"... and that dropped too.

However, the one thing that never drops is when it comes to taking my bills. Strange, isn't it?

And the best part: are you planning to upgrade your services? Which services exactly? Because right now, apart from the constant problems, I don't see anything.

In January, I'm going back to Proximus. Maybe a bit more expensive, but at least it works‚Äîand I've never had so many problems as with Orange.

P.S.: The Wi-Fi is just as bad, it cuts out all the time, very convenient for working...

Nous sommes vraiment d√©sol√©s pour les nombreux soucis techniques rencontr√©s depuis votre transfert, ainsi que pour la frustration li√©e √† notre service client. (Translated by Google) I had a new mobile phone, kept my phone number, and simply needed a smaller SIM card. I wanted to call the store in Oudenaarde first, but the Orange shops don't have a phone number to help customers. They sent me back home to Zottegem because they needed my ID card. I had wanted to call them first to get that information. They gave me a small SIM card, which was supposed to be activated Thursday morning, which turned out not to be the case. Because you can't call the store in Oudenaarde, I called the Orange helpdesk on Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. They kept me waiting on the phone for hours, and each explanation was more absurd than the last. Strangely enough, the SIM card seemed to be activated on Monday. I was actually ready to drive from Zottegem to the store in Oudenaarde again. I'd heard from Test-Aankoop that people should avoid stores and online stores that can't be reached by phone. So, I was completely dissatisfied with Orange and the Orange shops.

(Original)
Ik had een nieuw mobieltje, het telefoonnr bleef en ik had gewoon een kleinere sim kaart nodig.  Ik wou eerst telefoneren naar de winkel in Oudenaarde maar een telefoonnr om de klanten te helpen hebben ze niet in de Orange shops. Ze stuurden me opnieuw naar huis naar Zottegem omdat ze mijn identiteitskaart nodig hadden. Voor die info had ik hen eerst willen opbellen.  Ze gaven me een kleine SIM kaart, deze zou donderdag morgen geactiveerd zijn wat niet zo bleek te zijn. Omdat je dus niet kan telefoneren met de winkel in Oudenaarde telefoneerde ik donderdag, vrijdag, zaterdag, zondag met de Orange helpdesk. Uren lieten ze me wachten aan de telefoon en de ene uitleg was al onzinniger dan de andere.  Raar maar waar, maandag leek de SIM kaart wel geactiveerd.  Ik was eigenlijk al klaar om opnieuw van Zottegem naar de winkel in Oudenaarde te rijden.  Ik vernam van Test-Aankoop dat men eigenlijk winkels en webshops moet mijden die telefonisch niet bereikbaar zijn. Totaal ontevreden dus over Orange en over de Orange shops.

(Translated by Google) There was a problem with my parents-in-law's mobile phone number. After calling customer service, we were told we had to go to an Orange store to resolve the issue and that they could help us there, but that wasn't possible over the phone.
So we did, but the woman behind the counter didn't even bother to look up or check anything.
After explaining my problem, she said we would have to sign up for a subscription to resolve the issue with the prepaid card, which settled the matter for her. Naturally, we didn't do this.
A ‚Ç¨25 top-up will last my parents-in-law six months; you don't get a ‚Ç¨15 per month subscription for that.
When we left the store, my wife called customer service again while we were still outside because we weren't sure what to do.
The woman on the phone then informed my wife how to resolve the problem. Finally, someone who knows her job and offered us the necessary help. Someone who can actually provide information instead of trying to sell us an unnecessary subscription with lies. The result was a problem solved, but only after a pointless phone call with someone who can't do their job, who then referred us to the store where someone else can't do their job either.
A nice waste of an hour and a parking ticket for nothing.
The result is that when the card's credit runs out, we'll be switching providers. I've been looking for an email address to send my complaint directly to Orange, but I can't find it, and I'm starting to understand why.
Too bad.

(Original)
Er was een probleem met het mobiele telefoonnummer van mijn schoonouders, na telefonisch contact met de klanten dienst werden we verteld dat we naar een orange store moesten om het probleem op te lossen en dat men ons daar kon helpen en telefonisch was dit niet mogelijk.
Dit hebben we dan ook gedaan, de juffrouw achter de balie heeft zelfs de moeite niet gedaan om iets op te zoeken of na te kijken.
Na de uitleg van mijn probleem werd gezegd dat we we een abonnement zouden moeten nemen om het probleem met de herlaadkaart op te lossen, daarmee was de zaak afgehandeld voor haar. We hebben dit uiteraard niet gedaan.
Met een herlaadbeurt van 25‚Ç¨ komen mijn schoonouders 6 maand verder, dan neem je geen abonnement van 15‚Ç¨ per maand.
Bij het buiten komen uit de store heeft mijn echtgenote nogmaals naar de klantendienst gebeld terwijl we zelf nog buiten de winkel stonden, omdat we het niet vertrouwden.
Mijn vrouw heeft dan via de dame aan de telefoon info gekregen over hoe we het probleem moesten oplossen. Eindelijk iemand die haar job wel kent en ons de nodige hulp aangeboden heeft. Die wel info kan geven ipv een onnodig abonnement te proberen aansmeren met leugens. Gevolg probleem opgelost, maar wel na een zinloze telefoon met iemand die zijn job niet kan, die ons doorstuurde naar de winkel waar er ook iemand zijn job niet kan.
Leuk een uur tijd kwijt en een parkingticket voor niets.
Het resultaat is dat we als het beltegoed van de kaart op is, we zullen overstappen naar een andere provider.Ik heb gezocht naar een mailadres om mijn klacht rechtstreeks te richten aan Orange, maar deze is onvindbaar en ik begin te begrijpen waarom.
Jammer.

(Translated by Google)
So, I went to their store on December 8th, 2025, to replace my Tempo card, which I'd misplaced! Actually, it wasn't misplaced, I'd damaged it. I went to their store because it's not possible to do anything online, and I was told to go to an Orange store. When I showed up with my ID and asked for a duplicate Tempo card, they refused because they don't issue them anymore! I was surprised myself, and I told them I was there because of my conversation with customer service. He pointed out to me that this wasn't done anymore and that it was just too bad‚Ä¶ I had credit on that calling card, of course, and it's a number I've had for years, so I called 5000 again. The advisor there told me, of course, that he absolutely had to issue me a card, so I went back to the store and spoke to an Orange employee who seemed to understand the salesperson's ambition. He told me to ask for a blank SIM card. He said he'd do the work for me. So I asked for a blank SIM card, and the salesperson's response was, "He's going to push a subscription on me!"

I gave them the SIM card details, and thankfully, my card was back up and running within 15 minutes.

Actually, what a hassle! I think they were the ones trying to force me into a subscription against my will! It's a shame to neglect the functionality of a prepaid card, which, as a reminder, I top up with over ‚Ç¨250 annually. I don't want a subscription since I already have one; I use this card as a payment gateway for online services like Parking!, an app on the Play Store, and premium SMS messages, all to avoid any surprises on my bill. It's truly regrettable.

column4:
Tres de√ßu ...Publicit√© mensong√®re. Achetez un nouveau telephone et comme on est tres vert, on vous reprend votre ancien telephone (avec cashback) (ReCycle). Action speciale en plus du recyclage + 40 euros si vous commandez via internet. Je n'ai bien sur jamais eu ces 40 euros et apres passage chez Orange , confirmation que ce n'est jamais le cas...
Telephone de moins d'un an sans aucun soucis (toujours rest√© dans la coque avec protege ecran ) CompRecycle (contractant de Orange) me renvoi un email me disant qu'ils ne peuvent malheuresement pas donner suite ( donc 0 euro) avec des photos (preuves a l'appui) qui ne correspondent pas du tout a mon t√©l√©phone. Ce t√©l√©phone sera tres prochainement revendu comme certifi√© neuf (recycled). Ceci est une arnaque qui est deja remont√©e vers test achats. Une plainte va etre d√©pos√©e d'ici quelques minutes chez orange m√™me.

Si par hasard le service client veut me contacter, ils sont les bienvenues. Pour ma part je termine le mois et a partir de septembre je repasse a la concurence ou finalement j'aurais du rester. Un client de perdu... qui aurait tres bien pu se regler via un geste commercial. Internet business + 5 GSMs .... directement a la concurence.

Comment un telephone Samsung A53 black peut il avoir une coque argent√©e ( premiere photo (celle d'un iPhone d'apres les boutons sur le cot√©)), pourquoi la photo de l'ecran est sans protege ecran alors que celle, vue de cot√©, est avec une protege ecran. De plus .... pourquoi y a t il un protege ecran alors que je l'ai moi meme enlev√© avant de l'envoyer.

Reponse .. ces photos ne sont pas de mon t√©l√©phone.....

(Translated by Google)
Very disappointed... False advertising. Buy a new phone and, because they're so eco-friendly, they'll take back your old phone (with cashback) (ReCycle). Special offer in addition to recycling + 40 euros if you order online. Of course, I never received this 40 euros, and after contacting Orange, they confirmed that this is never the case... My phone is less than a year old and has had no problems (always kept in its case with a screen protector). CompRecycle (an Orange contractor) sent me an email saying that they unfortunately cannot process the claim (so 0 euros) with photos (proof included) that don't correspond to my phone at all. This phone will very soon be resold as certified new (recycled). This is a scam that has already been reported to Test Achats (a consumer protection organization). A complaint will be filed with Orange itself within a few minutes.

If by chance customer service would like to contact me, they are welcome. For my part, I'm finishing the month and starting in September I'm switching back to the competition, where I should have stayed. A lost customer... which could very well have been resolved with a goodwill gesture. Business internet + 5 mobile phones... straight to the competition.

How can a Samsung A53 black phone have a silver case (first photo (that of an iPhone, judging by the buttons on the side)), why is the photo of the screen without a screen protector while the side view has one? Furthermore... why is there a screen protector when I removed it myself before sending it?

Answer... these photos are not from my phone...

Franchement, c‚Äôest l‚Äôune des pires exp√©riences que j‚Äôaie eues avec un fournisseur Internet. Le service d‚ÄôOrange est cens√© √™tre ‚Äúpremium‚Äù, mais la r√©alit√©, c‚Äôest surtout un wifi qui rame en permanence, des coupures intempestives et une qualit√© de connexion qui semble sortie d‚Äôun autre si√®cle.

Le wifi est tellement instable qu‚Äôon se demande presque s‚Äôil ne fonctionne pas au charbon. Regarder une vid√©o ? Impossible sans attendre le chargement toutes les deux minutes. Travailler ? Une torture. M√™me envoyer un simple message parfois rel√®ve du miracle.

Quant au service g√©n√©ral‚Ä¶ on a l‚Äôimpression de payer tr√®s cher pour un r√©sultat franchement m√©diocre. C‚Äôest frustrant, d√©cevant, et √ßa donne surtout envie d‚Äôaller voir ailleurs.

Bref : si vous cherchez un wifi fiable et une qualit√© digne de 2025, passez votre chemin. Orange, pour moi, c‚Äôest non.

(Translated by Google)
Frankly, this is one of the worst experiences I've ever had with an internet provider. Orange's service is supposed to be "premium," but the reality is mostly constantly slow Wi-Fi, frequent disconnections, and connection quality that seems to belong to another century.

The Wi-Fi is so unstable you almost wonder if it's running on coal. Watching a video? Impossible without waiting for it to buffer every two minutes. Working? Torture. Even sending a simple message sometimes feels like a miracle.

As for the overall service... you get the feeling you're paying a fortune for a frankly mediocre result. It's frustrating, disappointing, and makes you want to look elsewhere.

In short: if you're looking for reliable Wi-Fi and quality worthy of 2025, look elsewhere. For me, Orange is a no-go.

Since November 29th, I've been requesting a migration from VOO to Orange, and since Sunday, I've had no TV. The message on the screen says "You are not subscribed to this channel."
They disconnected the decoder.
I've already been to the store three times and been connected to two different people on tablets. I've called dozens of times, and still nothing works.
At the beginning of the week, I requested a technician visit to install another decoder. The appointment was for Wednesday, December 10th, between 1 PM and 6 PM. I'm self-employed, so I made sure I was there.

At 6:20 PM, the technician called to tell me he couldn't come. Of course!

A new appointment was scheduled for Friday, December 12th, between 10 AM and 3 PM.
It's 4:28 PM, and still no one has arrived.
They're really taking us for fools; that's all they know how to do. I demand not to pay the bill, which of course has already been sent to me!
In this day and age, nobody does their job properly or with any professional conscience anymore. A sad future indeed!

(Translated by Google) I would like to express my deep dissatisfaction regarding my experience at the Orange store in the Wijnegem Shopping Center. I was refused service twice, under the pretext that the employee could not access the Oasis guarantee system due to a supposedly "forgotten" login. I was then told that I would be better off going to another store, specifically in Brasschaat or Antwerp.
Following this course of events, I will be filing a formal complaint with Orange's head office. Test-Aankoop will also be informed of these business practices.
Furthermore, I have decided to cancel my Orange subscription as soon as possible.
The employee involved, Sacha (red/blonde with glasses ‚Äì see Ariel's review), behaved extremely unprofessionally and arrogantly during these interactions and also adopted an intimidating attitude. I would like to explicitly state that this incident occurred in the presence of my family, which makes the situation all the more inappropriate. Considering this experience, I can only conclude that the negative reviews already published about this branch are completely justified.

(Original)
Ik wens mijn ernstige ongenoegen te uiten over mijn ervaring in het Orange-filiaal in het Wijnegem Shopping Center. Ik ben daar tot tweemaal toe geweigerd, onder het voorwendsel dat de medewerker geen toegang zou hebben tot het Oasis-garantiesysteem wegens een zogenaamd ‚Äúvergeten‚Äù login. Vervolgens werd mij meegedeeld dat ik mij beter tot een ander filiaal, met name Brasschaat of Antwerpen, kon wenden.
Naar aanleiding van deze gang van zaken zal ik een formele klacht indienen bij het hoofdkantoor van Orange. Tevens zal Test-Aankoop in kennis worden gesteld van deze handelspraktijken.
Daarnaast heb ik besloten mijn abonnement bij Orange zo spoedig mogelijk stop te zetten.
De betrokken medewerker, Sacha (ros/blond met brillen - cfr review Ariel), gedroeg zich tijdens deze interacties bijzonder onprofessioneel en arrogant en nam bovendien een intimiderende houding aan. Ik wens hierbij expliciet te vermelden dat dit incident plaatsvond in aanwezigheid van mijn gezin, wat de situatie des te ongepast maakt.
Gelet op deze ervaring kan ik enkel vaststellen dat de reeds gepubliceerde negatieve recensies over dit filiaal volledig terecht zijn.

Consternant !
Mon papa, 93 ans, doit remplacer sa t√©l√©commande. Je m'y rends moi m√™me (sans l'ancienne t√©l√©commande car il arrive encore √† zapper sur quelques cha√Ænes). Le vendeur me demande ma carte d'identit√©, que je lui donne (je suis aussi client VOO et Orange). Le vendeur me demande l'ancienne t√©l√©commande en √©change de la nouvelle ; je lui fais part de la situation et lui signale que je la d√©poserai le soir m√™me. Le vendeur a alors d√©nigr√© plusieurs fois les clients "qui promettent toujours de ramener leur t√©l√©commande d√©fectueuse mais qui ne la ram√®nent jamais". Il me r√©p√®te cela √† 3 reprises !
J'ai repris ma carte d'identit√© et suis reparti sans nouvelle t√©l√©commande.

Appalling!
My 93-year-old father needed to replace his remote control. I went to the store myself (without the old remote because he can still change channels). The salesperson asked for my ID, which I gave him (I'm also a VOO and Orange customer). The salesperson asked for the old remote in exchange for the new one; I explained the situation and told him I would drop it off that evening. The salesperson then repeatedly disparaged customers "who always promise to return their faulty remote but never do." He repeated this three times!

I took my ID back and left without a new remote.
How can a salesperson be so dismissive of the customers who pay him? All this fuss over a remote control when he has all my contact information to call me back if necessary? Is VOO/Orange raising its prices in January because of faulty remotes that customers never return? Pathetic. My 93-year-old dad doesn't thank you!
